content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-102-05-B
|Item_parent=Diplopia
|Item_parent_short=Diplopia
|Rank=B
|Title=Know the definition of tropies
|Description=exotropy, esotropy, hypertropy
|Topic=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=
|Order=5}}
Tropia (or strabismus): deviation of the visual axes.

'''- Esotropia:''' inward deviation of the eye

'''- Exotropia''': outward deviation of the eye

'''- Hypertropia:''' upward deviation of the eye

'''- Hypotropia:''' downward deviation of the eye

question.title: What is the term for the inward deviation of the eye?

option_a.title: Exotropia
option_a.description: A type of strabismus characterized by outward deviation of the eye

option_b.title: Hypertropia
option_b.description: A type of strabismus characterized by upward deviation of the eye

option_c.title: Hypotropia
option_c.description: A type of strabismus characterized by downward deviation of the eye

option_d.title: Esotropia
option_d.description: A type of strabismus characterized by inward deviation of the eye

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
